description: MPII Human Pose dataset is a state-of-the-art benchmark for evaluating articulated human pose estimation. It includes 25K images containing over 40K people with annotated body joints. The images were collected based on a taxonomy of everyday human activities and span 410 different human activities. Each image has an activity label, and the dataset also includes preceding and following un-annotated frames for each image. Richer annotations are provided in the test set, including body part occlusions and 3D torso and head orientations.

annotations.body_joints: Each person in the dataset is annotated with body joints for pose estimation.
annotations.activity_labels: Each image includes an activity label based on the 410 human activities covered.

collection.frame_extraction: Images are extracted from YouTube videos, including preceding and following un-annotated frames.

evaluation.test_annotations: Withheld to prevent overfitting. An automatic evaluation server and performance analysis tools will be provided.
evaluation.benchmark: Performance evaluation follows best practices for preventing overfitting and tuning on the test set.
